item.title: Overview
item.description: Chapar - Native API Testing Tool linkChapar is an upcoming native API testing tool built with GoLang, designed to simplify and expedite the testing process for developers. While still in its early beta phase, Chapar aims to offer a user-friendly experience with support for both HTTP and gRPC protocols with. What Chapar means? linkChapar was the institution of the royal mounted couriers in ancient Persia. The messengers, called Chapar, alternated in stations a day’s ride apart along the Royal Road.

item.title: Quickstart
item.description: Installation linkTo install Chapar, you can download the latest release or build the project from source. Download the latest release linkYou can download the latest release from the releases page. Be sure to download the version that is compatible with your operating system. Install From Source linkTo install Chapar from source, clone the repository install the dependencies, and run the application using the following commands: git clone https://github.com/chapar-rest/chapar.git cd chapar go build -o chapar .

item.title: How to Contribute
item.description: Contribute to code linkContributing to the codebase is a great way to help improve the project. Hereâ€™s how you can get started: Create a Pull Request link Fork the repository: Click the “Fork” button in the top right corner of the repository page to create your own copy of the repo. Clone the repository: Clone your forked repository to your local machine using git clone . Create a new branch: Create a new branch for your changes with a descriptive name, such as feature/add-new-feature or fix/bug-description.

item.title: Code of Conduct
item.description: Our Pledge linkWe as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, or sexual identity and orientation. We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.
